name: AMRAP Method
description: A method focusing on explosive strength using a single AMRAP (As Many Reps As Possible) set with cyclical progression.
long_description: The AMRAP Method operates on a cyclical progression model where athletes perform a single maximal-effort set to failure per session. Starting with moderate loads near 50% of capacity, the lifter executes repetitions with maximum explosive velocity, strictly ensuring a distinct muscular pause at the bottom to eliminate momentum and rebound. As weight increases incrementally each session, the repetition count naturally decreases from high ranges down to a threshold (typically 15 reps), triggering a cycle reset that drives continuous neural and hypertrophic adaptation.
dos: Do warm up thoroughly before the main set.
Do perform the repetitions as explosively as possible.
Do track your records meticulously.
donts: Don't grind the reps; speed is key.
Don't do this for every exercise; focus on main compounds.

name: Jim Wendler's 5/3/1
description: A slow and steady progression system based on monthly cycles using 90% of your 1RM.
long_description: One of the most popular strength programs in existence. It revolves around four main lifts (Squat, Deadlift, Bench, Press) and uses a wave loading progression over 3 or 4 weeks. It emphasizes starting light and progressing slowly.
dos: Do calculate your training max correctly (90% of true 1RM).
Do focus on the PR set (the final set of the main lift).
Do stick to the program for at least 6 months.
donts: Don't increase the weight faster than the program prescribes.
Don't skip the assistance work (but don't overdo it either).

name: Madcow 5x5
description: A weekly periodization model for those who have stalled on beginner linear progression.
long_description: Unlike beginner programs where you increase weight every workout, Madcow increases weight weekly. It utilizes 'ramping sets' where only the final set of 5 is the heavy top set.
dos: Do follow the spreadsheet/calculator strictly.
Do treat the light day (Wednesday) seriously for recovery.
donts: Don't underestimate the volume; it catches up quickly.
Don't skip the deload weeks.

name: PHAT
description: Power Hypertrophy Adaptive Training. Combines heavy lifting and bodybuilding work.
long_description: Dr. Layne Norton's program. The first two days of the week are split into Upper and Lower Power days. The last three days are bodybuilding 'hypertrophy' days with higher reps and shorter rest periods.
dos: Do keep the power days heavy and the hypertrophy days explosive.
Do manage fatigue; this is a high-volume program.
donts: Don't lift heavy on hypertrophy days; focus on the 'pump'.
Don't skip the rest days.

name: Smolov
description: A very intense Russian squat cycle designed to add significant weight to your max.
long_description: Split into phases (Base, Switching, Intense). It requires squatting 4 times a week at high percentages. High risk of injury but high reward.
dos: Do eat and sleep significantly more than usual.
Do stretch and foam roll daily.
donts: Don't do this if you have any existing injuries.
Don't perform other heavy leg work (deadlifts) during the Base cycle.

name: Deadlift
description: Lifting a dead weight from the floor. Builds total body strength.
long_description: Engages the hamstrings, glutes, lower back, lats, and grip. It is a pure test of strength requiring lifting the bar from the floor to a lockout position.
dos: Do keep the bar close to your shins.
Do engage your lats before pulling.
donts: Don't round your lower back (cat back).
Don't hyperextend your back at the top.

name: Bench Press
description: The primary upper body pushing exercise. Targets chest, shoulders, and triceps.
long_description: Lying on a bench, the athlete un-racks the weight, lowers it to the chest, and presses it back up. It allows for the heaviest loading of the upper body musculature.
dos: Do keep your feet planted firmly on the floor.
Do retract your shoulder blades (pinch them together).
donts: Don't flare your elbows out 90 degrees.
Don't bounce the bar off your chest.

name: Step Ups
description: A unilateral leg exercise that builds quads and glutes while improving balance.
long_description: Step onto a stable box/bench with one foot, drive through the whole foot to stand tall, then control the descent back to the floor. Can be done bodyweight or loaded with dumbbells for progressive overload.
dos: Do keep your torso tall and core braced.
Do drive through your whole foot and control the lowering.
donts: Don't push off aggressively with the back leg.
Don't use a box height that forces your pelvis to tilt or your knee to cave in.

name: Jump Rope
description: A simple, scalable cardio drill that improves coordination and footwork.
long_description: Using a jump rope, perform small, rhythmic hops while maintaining an upright posture. Keep the jumps low, land softly, and turn the rope with the wrists rather than the arms. Excellent for warm-ups, intervals, and general conditioning.
dos: Do keep your jumps low and land softly on the midfoot.
Do rotate the rope with your wrists to stay efficient.
donts: Don't stomp or jump excessively high.
Don't let your shoulders shrug up; stay relaxed.

name: Running
description: A foundational cardio activity for endurance, health, and conditioning.
long_description: Run at an easy steady pace for aerobic base, or use intervals for conditioning. Maintain a tall posture, slight forward lean, and quick light steps. Progress volume gradually to reduce injury risk.
dos: Do build volume gradually (10% rule as a guideline).
Do keep a cadence that feels quick and light.
donts: Don't increase intensity and volume at the same time.
Don't ignore persistent pain; adjust and recover.

name: Low Bar Squat
description: A squat variation with the bar lower on the back to leverage the hips and posterior chain.
long_description: With the bar placed across the rear delts (below the traps), the lifter uses a slightly more forward torso angle and hip drive. Often allows heavier loads and is common in powerlifting. Maintain a rigid brace and consistent bar path over midfoot.
dos: Do create a stable shelf on the rear delts and keep wrists neutral.
Do brace hard and keep the bar over midfoot.
donts: Don't let the bar roll up your back as you stand.
Don't lose upper-back tightness; it collapses the squat.

name: High Bar Squat
description: A squat variation with the bar on the upper traps, typically more upright and quad-focused.
long_description: With the bar resting higher on the traps, the lifter generally maintains a more upright torso and allows the knees to travel forward more, increasing quad involvement. Keep the bar path vertical over midfoot and control depth with a strong brace.
dos: Do keep your chest up and ribs down with a strong brace.
Do let knees track over toes and keep heels grounded.
donts: Don't relax at the bottom; stay tight.
Don't shift to the toes; keep pressure balanced over midfoot.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Press
description: An overhead press using dumbbells for a larger range of motion and unilateral control.
long_description: Press two dumbbells overhead from shoulder height to a stable lockout. Dumbbells allow natural wrist and elbow paths and can be done seated or standing. Control the lowering phase and avoid bouncing.
dos: Do control the eccentric and keep forearms vertical.
Do keep your core braced and avoid leaning back.
donts: Don't let dumbbells drift too far forward; keep them stacked.
Don't slam them together overhead.

name: Military Press — Barbell
description: A strict barbell overhead press performed with feet close together, emphasizing shoulder strength and core stability.
long_description: Standard military press is done with heels touching. This narrow base forces more core engagement and eliminates leg drive. Keep the bar path vertical and finish with biceps by ears.
dos: Do keep your heels close together.
Do squeeze your glutes and abs hard.
donts: Don't use any leg drive.
Don't arch your back excessively.

name: Military Press — Dumbbells
description: A strict dumbbell overhead press using a narrow stance to challenge balance and shoulder control.
long_description: Perform a standing dumbbell press with feet close together. Using dumbbells requires more stabilization than a barbell and helps identify strength imbalances between sides.
dos: Do maintain a narrow stance.
Do control the dumbbells throughout the full range of motion.
donts: Don't allow the dumbbells to drift away from your body.
Don't use leg drive.

name: Dumbbell Biceps Curl
description: A classic isolation movement for the biceps using dumbbells.
long_description: Curl the dumbbells from arms-extended to shoulder height while keeping elbows close to the torso. Use a controlled tempo and avoid swinging. Can be done alternating or both arms together.
dos: Do keep elbows pinned and move only at the elbow joint.
Do control the lowering and fully extend between reps.
donts: Don't swing your torso to cheat the weight up.
Don't let wrists collapse; keep them neutral.

name: Hammer Curl
description: A neutral-grip curl that emphasizes brachialis and forearms.
long_description: Hold dumbbells with palms facing each other and curl without supinating. Keep elbows close and avoid shoulder swing. Great accessory for elbow health and grip/forearm development.
dos: Do keep a neutral wrist and steady elbow position.
Do control both the lift and the lowering.
donts: Don't turn it into a front raise; avoid shoulder flexion.
Don't let the dumbbells drift behind you.

name: Barbell Biceps Curl
description: A curl with a straight bar that allows heavier loading than dumbbells.
long_description: Using a supinated grip on a barbell, curl the weight up while keeping elbows close and shoulders down. Maintain a tight core and avoid swinging. The barbell provides a fixed hand position and stable loading.
dos: Do keep your ribs down and glutes tight to prevent swing.
Do use a full range of motion with controlled tempo.
donts: Don't lean back to 'hip thrust' the bar up.
Don't shrug shoulders forward at the top.

name: Pull-ups
description: A bodyweight vertical pull focusing on lats, upper back, and biceps.
long_description: Hang from a pull-up bar with a pronated grip, then pull your chest toward the bar by driving elbows down and back. Control the descent to a full hang. Use assistance or bands if needed to maintain quality reps.
dos: Do start each rep from a controlled hang and engage the lats.
Do think 'elbows to pockets' to avoid overusing the arms.
donts: Don't kip or swing unless you're doing a specific kipping style.
Don't crane your neck; keep it neutral.

name: Dips
description: A bodyweight pressing movement that builds triceps and chest.
long_description: Support yourself on parallel bars, lower under control until shoulders are comfortably below elbows (as mobility allows), then press back up to lockout. A slight forward lean increases chest involvement; a more upright torso shifts emphasis to triceps.
dos: Do keep shoulders down and stable and use a controlled range.
Do lock out with control at the top.
donts: Don't dive-bomb into the bottom position.
Don't force depth past a comfortable shoulder range.

name: Push-ups
description: A foundational bodyweight push exercise for chest, shoulders, and triceps.
long_description: From a plank position with hands under shoulders, lower the chest toward the floor while keeping body rigid, then press back up. Variations (incline, decline, weighted) adjust difficulty. Great for volume and technique practice.
dos: Do keep a straight line from head to heels and brace your core.
Do use a full range of motion with controlled tempo.
donts: Don't let hips sag or pike up.
Don't flare elbows excessively; keep a comfortable angle.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
description: A challenging unilateral squat variation that targets quads and glutes.
long_description: With the rear foot elevated on a bench/box, lower the hips down and slightly back by bending the front knee and hip, then drive up through the front foot. Great for building single-leg strength and addressing left/right imbalances.
dos: Do keep your front foot planted and knee tracking over toes.
Do control depth and keep your torso stable.
donts: Don't bounce off the bottom.
Don't let the front heel lift off the ground.

name: Barbell Row
description: A compound horizontal pull that builds lats, upper back, and grip.
long_description: Hinge at the hips with a flat back, then row the barbell toward the lower ribs/upper abdomen. Control the eccentric and keep the torso angle consistent. Great balance to pressing volume.
dos: Do keep your back flat and brace your core.
Do pull elbows back and squeeze the upper back.
donts: Don't use excessive body English to move the load.
Don't round the lower back during the hinge.

name: Leg Press
description: A machine-based compound leg exercise allowing heavy loading.
long_description: Sit in the machine with back flat against the pad. Place feet on the platform shoulder-width apart. Lower the weight until knees are bent around 90 degrees, then drive back up without locking out knees excessively.
dos: Do keep your lower back pressed against the pad.
Do control the descent.
donts: Don't lock your knees forcefully at the top.
Don't perform 'ego reps' with limited range of motion.

name: Leg Extension
description: An isolation exercise for the quadriceps performed on a machine.
long_description: Sit with the pad adjusted against your lower shins. Extend your legs until they are straight, squeezing the quads at the top. Lower under control. Great for finishing the quads.
dos: Do adjust the machine to align your knee with the pivot point.
Do squeeze hard at the top.
donts: Don't swing the weight up.
Don't go too heavy and sacrifice form.

name: Leg Curl
description: Isolates the hamstrings through knee flexion using a machine.
long_description: Can be seated or lying. Curl the pad towards your glutes by contracting the hamstrings. Control the eccentric phase to fully lengthen the muscle.
dos: Do keep your hips pressed against the pad.
Do control the release of the weight.
donts: Don't lift your hips off the pad to assist the weight.
Don't kick the weight down; control it.

name: Lat Pulldown
description: A vertical pulling exercise for the lats, simulating a pull-up.
long_description: Sit with knees secured under pads. Grasp the bar with a wide grip and pull it down to your upper chest, leading with the elbows. Excellent for building back width.
dos: Do initiate the pull by depressing shoulder blades.
Do bring the bar to the upper chest, not the stomach.
donts: Don't lean back excessively.
Don't use momentum to jerk the weight down.

name: Seated Cable Row
description: A horizontal pulling exercise for the mid-back and lats.
long_description: Sit with feet on the platform and knees slightly bent. Pull the handle toward your lower abdomen, retracting the scapula. Keep the torso relatively upright.
dos: Do squeeze your shoulder blades together at the peak.
Do keep a neutral spine.
donts: Don't round your back forward.
Don't lean way back to leverage the weight.

name: Pec Deck Fly
description: Isolates the chest muscles horizontally without triceps involvement.
long_description: Sit with back flat on pad. Place forearms or grip handles depending on the machine. Bring arms together in front of the chest, squeezing the pecs. Open wide to stretch the muscle.
dos: Do keep elbows slightly below shoulder height.
Do focus on the stretch and the squeeze.
donts: Don't bang the weights together.
Don't overstretch shoulder joints range of motion.

name: Triceps Pushdown
description: A cable exercise targeting the triceps muscles.
long_description: Stand facing a high pulley with a rope or bar attachment. Keep elbows pinned to your sides and extend the forearms down until arms are straight. Squeeze triceps at the bottom.
dos: Do keep elbows fixed at your sides.
Do use a full range of motion.
donts: Don't use bodyweight to press the bar down.
Don't let elbows flare out too much.

name: Face Pull
description: A cable exercise for the rear deltoids and rotater cuff.
long_description: Set pulley to face height. Pull the rope towards your face/forehead, separating the hands and driving elbows back and externally rotating the shoulders. Crucial for shoulder health.
dos: Do focus on pulling the rope apart.
Do hold the contraction for a second.
donts: Don't go too heavy; form is priority.
Don't jut your head forward.

name: Incline Bench Press
description: Bench pressing on an inclined angle to target the upper pectorals.
long_description: Lie on a bench inclined at roughly 30-45 degrees. Unrack the bar and lower it to the upper chest/collarbone area. Press back up. Increases shoulder involvement compared to flat bench.
dos: Do keep your elbows tucked at roughly 45 degrees.
Do control the bar path to the upper chest.
donts: Don't bridge your hips excessively.
Don't bounce the bar off your clavicles.

name: Front Squat
description: A squat variant where the bar is racked on the front delts.
long_description: Rest the bar on the front deltoids, keeping elbows high to create a shelf. Squat down with a very upright torso. Places high demand on quads and upper back strength.
dos: Do keep your elbows as high as possible throughout.
Do brace your abs hard.
donts: Don't let your upper back round forward.
Don't let the bar slide down your arms.

name: Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
description: A hip-hinge movement starting from the top down, focusing on the stretch.
long_description: Start standing with the bar. Hinge hips back while keeping legs slightly bent but rigid. Lower bar along shins until you feel a deep stretch in hamstrings, then drive hips forward to stand.
dos: Do keep the bar in contact with your legs.
Do focus on pushing hips back, not bending over.
donts: Don't round your lower back.
Don't lower weights past your flexibility limit.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
description: An isolation exercise for broadening the shoulders.
long_description: Stand with dumbbells at sides. Raise arms out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, leading with the elbows. Lower under control. Critical for the 'V-taper' look.
dos: Do lead with your elbows.
Do keep a slight bend in the arms.
donts: Don't swing the weights up with your hips.
Don't raise hands higher than elbows.

name: Skullcrushers
description: Lying triceps extension using a barbell or EZ-bar.
long_description: Lie on a bench holding the bar above chest. Bend elbows to lower the bar towards the forehead or behind head. Extend arms back to starting position. Hits the long head of the triceps.
dos: Do keep elbows pointed towards the ceiling (mostly).
Do control the bar carefully near your head.
donts: Don't flare elbows out too wide.
Don't use momentum.

name: Walking Lunges
description: A dynamic unilateral leg exercise moving forward.
long_description: Take a step forward, lower hips until back knee hovers over ground, then drive up and forward into the next step. Can be loaded with dumbbells or barbell.
dos: Do keep your torso upright (or slight lean for glutes).
Do keep knees in line with toes.
donts: Don't smash your knee into the ground.
Don't take steps that are too short.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
description: The premier exercise for isolating and overloading the glutes.
long_description: Sit with upper back against a bench and barbell in the hip crease (use a pad!). Drive hips up until body is parallel to floor and glutes heavily contracted. Lower down with control.
dos: Do chin tuck to keep spine neutral.
Do forcefuly squeeze glutes at the top.
donts: Don't hyperextend your lower back.
Don't use just your hamstrings; mind-muscle connection is key.

name: Cycling (Indoor)
description: Stationary cycling for cardiovascular conditioning.
long_description: Using a spinning bike or stationary cycle. Great for low-impact cardio. Can be steady state or high intensity intervals.
dos: Do adjust seat height so leg is almost straight at bottom.
Do engage core slightly.
donts: Don't hunch over the handlebars excessively.
Don't bounce in the saddle at high rpm.

name: Cycling (Outdoor)
description: Riding a bicycle outdoors.
long_description: Excellent for cardiovascular health and leg endurance. Varies greatly with terrain.
dos: Do wear a helmet.
Do follow traffic rules.
donts: Don't ignore hydration on long rides.
Don't ride with poor visibility without lights.

name: Rowing
description: A full-body cardiovascular exercise using a rowing machine (ergometer).
long_description: Push with legs, lean back slightly, then pull arms to chest. Reverse the specific sequence. Uses over 80% of muscles in body.
dos: Do drive with legs first, not arms.
Do keep a straight back.
donts: Don't shoot your butt out early.
Don't elevate shoulders to your ears.

name: Swimming
description: Propelling through water using limbs. Zero impact on joints.
long_description: Includes various strokes (Freestyle, Breaststroke, Butterfly, Backstroke). Provides high resistance and cardio demand while cooling the body.
dos: Do focus on rhythmic breathing.
Do maintain a streamlined body position.
donts: Don't hold your breath violently.
Don't fight the water; use technique.

name: Boxing
description: High intensity combat sport training.
long_description: Bag work, shadow boxing, or sparring. Builds immense shoulder endurance, core stability, and cardiovascular health.
dos: Do keep your hands up guarding your face.
Do rotate hips into punches.
donts: Don't hold your breath while punching.
Don't drop your guard when tired.

name: Hiking
description: Walking in nature, often with elevation gain.
long_description: Great for mental health and low intensity steady state cardio. Builds stabilizer muscles in ankles and knees due to uneven terrain.
dos: Do wear appropriate footwear.
Do bring water and supplies.
donts: Don't leave trash on the trail.
Don't underestimate weather changes.

name: Yoga
description: Physical, mental, and spiritual practices which originated in ancient India.
long_description: Involves holding poses (asanas), breathing techniques (pranayama), and meditation. Improves flexibility, balance, and stress relief.
dos: Do focus on your breath.
Do listen to your body's limits.
donts: Don't force yourself into painful positions.
Don't compare your flexibility to others.

name: Pilates
description: Low-impact exercise that aims to strengthen muscles while improving postural alignment and flexibility.
long_description: Emphasizes core strength, control, precision, and breath. Can be mat-based or use reformer machines.
dos: Do engage your deep core muscles.
Do maintain precise movements.
donts: Don't use momentum.
Don't rush the movements.

name: Elliptical
description: Stationary machine simulating walking/running without joint impact.
long_description: Moves feet in an ellipse pattern. Good for those with knee issues who want to do cardio.
dos: Do use the moving handles to engage upper body.
Do keep feet flat on the pedals.
donts: Don't lean heavily on the fixed handles.
Don't let toes go numb (move feet slightly).

name: Chest Press Machine
description: A machine-based pressing exercise for the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
long_description: Sit with your back flat against the pad and handles at chest height. Push the handles forward until arms are extended, then return with control. Great for learning the pressing movement safely.
dos: Do keep your elbows slightly below shoulder height.
Do control the weight on the way back.
donts: Don't lift your head off the pad.
Don't lock your elbows aggressively.

name: Shoulder Press Machine
description: A safer alternative to free weight overhead pressing.
long_description: Press the handles upward from shoulder height to full extension. Good for isolating the deltoids with constant tension.
dos: Do keep your core tight.
Do use a full range of motion.
donts: Don't arch your lower back excessively.
Don't jut your neck forward.

name: Hack Squat
description: A machine squat that stabilizes the back, allowing focus on quads.
long_description: Position yourself in the machine with shoulder pads resting on your shoulders. Lower down until knees are at 90 degrees or less, then drive back up. Excellent for quad development.
dos: Do keeping your back flat against the pad.
Do place feet to emphasize quads (lower) or glutes (higher).
donts: Don't let knees cave inward.
Don't lock out knees at the top.

name: Smith Machine Squat
description: Squatting with a guided bar path.
long_description: Place the bar on your traps. Unlock the safety hooks and squat down. The fixed path removes the need for stabilization, allowing you to focus on pushing.
dos: Do place feet slightly further forward than a free squat.
Do keep your torso upright.
donts: Don't rely solely on the machine for balance.
Don't round your back.

name: Assisted Pull-up
description: A machine that counterbalances your weight to make pull-ups easier.
long_description: Kneel or stand on the platform. The weight you select lifts you up, reducing the load you have to pull. Great for building up to bodyweight pull-ups.
dos: Do use a full range of motion.
Do control the descent.
donts: Don't swing your body.
Don't step off the platform while the weight is up.

name: Cable Crossover
description: A chest isolation exercise producing constant tension.
long_description: Stand between two high pulleys. Pull the handles down and across your body, squeezing the chest at the bottom. Varies the angle of attack on the pecs.
dos: Do keep a slight bend in elbows.
Do squeeze hard at the crossover point.
donts: Don't use momentum to swing the weight.
Don't shrug shoulders.

name: Cable Bicep Curl
description: Curling with a cable for constant resistance.
long_description: Stand facing a low pulley with a bar or rope attachment. Curl the weight up while keeping elbows pinned. The cable provides tension throughout the movement.
dos: Do keep elbows stationary.
Do squeeze at the top.
donts: Don't lean back to lift the weight.
Don't let the weight stack slam down.

name: Cable Overhead Extension
description: Overhead extension using a cable, targeting the long head of the triceps.
long_description: Face away from a low pulley or use a high pulley with a rope, extending arms overhead. Keep elbows high and close to head.
dos: Do keep abs braced to avoid arching back.
Do get a full stretch at the bottom.
donts: Don't flare elbows excessively.
Don't use too much weight that compromises form.

name: Seated Calf Raise
description: Isolates the soleus muscle of the calf.
long_description: Sit with knees bent at 90 degrees and pads on lower thighs. Raise heels as high as possible, then lower for a deep stretch. Targets the lower/outer calf muscle.
dos: Do pause at the bottom for a deep stretch.
Do pause at the top for a peak contraction.
donts: Don't bounce the weight.
Don't rush the reps.

name: Ab Crunch Machine
description: Weighted resistance for the abdominals.
long_description: Sit in the machine and grasp handles. Contract abs to curl the torso forward. Adds progressive overload to ab training.
dos: Do exhale as you crunch down.
Do use your abs, not your arms/hip flexors.
donts: Don't set the seat too high or low.
Don't slam the weights.

name: Back Extension
description: Strengthens the erector spinae and glutes.
long_description: Lock heels in the pad and hinge at the hips. Lower torso towards the floor, then raise back to parallel. Can be loaded with a plate.
dos: Do keep a neutral spine.
Do squeeze glutes at the top.
donts: Don't hyperextend (arch) excessively at the top.
Don't swing with momentum.

name: Close-Grip Lat Pulldown
description: Lat pulldown variation using a neutral close-grip handle.
long_description: Uses the v-bar handle. Pulls elbows down in front of the body, targeting the lower lats and involving more biceps.
dos: Do lead with the chest.
Do pull all the way to the upper chest.
donts: Don't lean way back.
Don't shrug shoulders.

name: Hip Adduction
description: Machine exercise for the adductor muscles (inner thigh).
long_description: Sit and squeeze legs together against resistance. Important for hip stability and injury prevention.
dos: Do use a controlled tempo.
Do keep your back against the seat.
donts: Don't go too wide in the stretch position.
Don't jerk the weight.

name: Hip Abduction
description: Machine exercise for the outer hip/glutes.
long_description: Sit and push legs outward against resistance. Targets the gluteus medius and minimus.
dos: Do pause at the full extension.
Do keep back flat.
donts: Don't use momentum.
Don't slouch forward unless targeting specific fibers intentionally.

name: Sumo Deadlift
description: Deadlift with a wide stance, emphasizing hips and quads more than conventional.
long_description: Stand wide with toes pointed out. Grip the bar inside the knees. Keep torso upright and drive hips forward. Reduces range of motion compared to conventional.
dos: Do keep knees wide, tracking over toes.
Do keep the bar close to your body.
donts: Don't let knees cave in.
Don't round your back.

name: Stiff-Legged Deadlift
description: A deadlift variation that keeps legs straighter to target hamstrings.
long_description: Start with bar hanging or on floor. Hinge at hips with legs almost straight (slight bend is okay). Lower until a deep hamstring stretch is felt, then return.
dos: Do keep back flat.
Do feel the stretch in the hamstrings.
donts: Don't lock knees completely if hyperextended.
Don't round lower back to get 'deeper'.

name: Good Morning
description: A hip hinge with the barbell on the back/traps.
long_description: With bar on back like a squat, hinge forward at the hips while keeping legs slightly bent. Strengthens lower back, glutes, and hamstrings.
dos: Do keep your lower back arched/tight.
Do start with light weight.
donts: Don't turn it into a squat.
Don't go below parallel of the torso unless flexible.

name: Pendlay Row
description: A bent-over row where the weight settles on the floor between each rep.
long_description: Bent over parallel to the floor. Pull the bar explosively from the ground to the chest/stomach, then return it to a dead stop on the floor.
dos: Do keep your back parallel to floor.
Do pull explosively.
donts: Don't use hip drive to lift the weight.
Don't stand up during the pull.

name: Close-Grip Bench Press
description: Bench pressing with a narrower grip to emphasize triceps.
long_description: Hands shoulder-width apart. Lower bar to lower chest. Keeps elbows tucked. Great for tricep mass and bench press lockout strength.
dos: Do keep elbows close to torso.
Do control the descent.
donts: Don't use a grip that strains wrists (too close).
Don't flare elbows.

name: Decline Bench Press
description: Bench pressing on a decline angle.
long_description: Target the sternal head of the pectoralis major. Often allows for more weight than flat bench due to mechanical advantage/reduced ROM.
dos: Do ensure legs are secured.
Do touch the bar to the lower chest.
donts: Don't let the bar drift back towards face.
Don't bounce off chest.

name: Floor Press
description: Bench press performed lying on the floor.
long_description: Reduces range of motion and takes legs out of the equation. Excellent for tricep strength and overcoming sticking points.
dos: Do pause when elbows touch the floor.
Do control the weight gently to the floor.
donts: Don't bounce elbows off the floor.
Don't loose tension at the bottom.

name: Barbell Shrug
description: Isolates the upper trapezius muscles.
long_description: Hold a heavy barbell in front of you. Shrug shoulders straight up towards ears, hold for a second, then lower. Builds the 'yoke'.
dos: Do squeeze hard at the top.
Do keep arms straight.
donts: Don't roll shoulders (bad for rotator cuff).
Don't use hips to jerk weights up.

name: Rack Pull
description: A partial deadlift starting from the knees or shins.
long_description: Set pins in a power rack. Pull heavy weight from the pins to lockout. Overloads the upper back and traps.
dos: Do keep neutral spine.
Do pull shoulders back at the top.
donts: Don't hyper-extend back at lockout.
Don't bounce bar off pins.

name: Preacher Curl
description: Curls performed on a preacher bench to eliminate swinging.
long_description: Arms rest on the slanted pad. Curls are strict and isolate the biceps brachii, specifically the short head.
dos: Do keep armpits snug against the pad.
Do control the negative.
donts: Don't lean back to pull.
Don't fully straighten arm if it causes elbow pain.

name: Zercher Squat
description: Squatting with the barbell held in the crooks of the elbows.
long_description: Builds immense core and upper back strength. Rest the bar on your forearms close to elbows. Squat down while keeping torso upright.
dos: Do wrap the bar or wear long sleeves (it hurts).
Do keep elbows high.
donts: Don't round your back.
Don't let the bar slide forward.

name: Arnold Press
description: Dumbbell press with a rotation, popularized by Arnold Schwarzenegger.
long_description: Start with palms facing you at shoulder height. Press up while rotating palms to face forward at the top. Hits all three heads of the deltoid.
dos: Do control the rotation.
Do use a full range of motion.
donts: Don't rush the movement.
Don't knock dumbbells together.

name: Dumbbell Pullover
description: An exercise that targets both the chest and the lats.
long_description: Lie perpendicular on a bench (upper back only) or flat. Hold one dumbbell with both hands above chest. Lower it backward over head until a stretch is felt.
dos: Do keep hips low.
Do keep a slight bend in elbows.
donts: Don't drop the weight on your face.
Don't overstretch shoulders.

name: Goblet Squat
description: Squatting while holding a weight at chest level.
long_description: Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell against your chest. Squat down between your legs. The front load acts as a counterbalance, making it easier to keep torso upright.
dos: Do start the movement by sitting back and down.
Do keep chest up.
donts: Don't let knees cave in.
Don't round forward.

name: Kettlebell Swing
description: A dynamic ballistic exercise taking the weight from between legs to shoulder height.
long_description: Hinge at hips, hike the bell back between legs, then violently snap hips forward to float the bell up. Strengthening posterior chain and cardio.
dos: Do use your hips, not your arms.
Do keep a flat back.
donts: Don't squat the swing (it's a hinge).
Don't overextend back at the top.

name: Turkish Get-Up
description: Transitioning from lying to standing while holding a weight overhead.
long_description: A complex multi-stage movement. Builds shoulder stability, core strength, and mobility.
dos: Do keep your eyes on the weight.
Do move slowly through each step.
donts: Don't rush.
Don't bend the elbow of the supporting arm.

name: Farmer's Walk
description: Walking while carrying heavy weights.
long_description: Pick up heavy dumbbells or kettlebells in each hand and walk for distance or time. Builds grip, traps, and core strength.
dos: Do keep chest tall and shoulders back.
Do take short, quick steps.
donts: Don't slouch.
Don't let weights swing excessively.

name: Stair Climber
description: Climbing revolving stairs for cardio.
long_description: Great low-impact cardio that also targets glutes and calves.
dos: Do stand upright.
Do use full steps.
donts: Don't lean on the rails to support your weight.
Don't take tiny half-steps.

name: Basketball
description: Team sport involving shooting, dribbling, and running.
long_description: High intensity interval nature with jumping and lateral movements.
dos: Do warm up ankles and knees.
Do stay low on defense.
donts: Don't play rough.
Don't ignore injuries.

name: Soccer
description: Field sport involving continuous running and footwork.
long_description: Excellent for aerobic capacity and leg coordination.
dos: Do keep moving.
Do communicate with teammates.
donts: Don't play in inappropriate footwear.
Don't tackle dangerously.

name: Tennis
description: Racquet sport requiring sprints and hand-eye coordination.
long_description: Involves short bursts of sprinting, lateral movement, and upper body rotation.
dos: Do split step before every shot.
Do watch the ball.
donts: Don't swing too hard; use technique.
Don't stop moving feet.

name: Volleyball
description: Team sport involving jumping and striking.
long_description: Great for explosive power (jumping) and reaction time.
dos: Do call the ball.
Do land softly from jumps.
donts: Don't touch the net.
Don't land on other players.

name: Golf
description: Club sport requiring mobility and precision.
long_description: Low intensity walking (if walking course) and rotational power.
dos: Do walk the course if possible.
Do stretch hips and back.
donts: Don't swing with all arm strength.
Don't forget sun protection.

name: Rock Climbing
description: Scaling vertical walls using holds.
long_description: Full body workout emphasizing grip strength, back, core, and tension.
dos: Do use your legs to push up.
Do keep arms straight when hanging.
donts: Don't overgrip.
Don't forget to check knots/safety.

name: Martial Arts
description: Practice of combat systems (Karate, Jiu-Jitsu, Muay Thai, etc.).
long_description: Varies by style but generally improves flexibility, strength, cardio, and mental discipline.
dos: Do respect training partners.
Do tap early.
donts: Don't have an ego.
Don't neglect warmups.

name: High Knees
description: Running in place bringing knees high.
long_description: Cardio drill. Pump arms and drive knees up to waist height rapidly.
dos: Do land on balls of feet.
Do stay upright.
donts: Don't lean back.
Don't let knees stay low.

name: Burpees
description: A full body exercise used in strength training and as an aerobic exercise.
long_description: Drop to a pushup position, do a pushup, jump feet in, and jump up with hands overhead. High caloric burn.
dos: Do maintain a rigid plank.
Do jump intensely.
donts: Don't snake up from the pushup.
Don't land with locked knees.

name: Mountain Climbers
description: Running motion in a plank position.
long_description: Start in plank. Drive one knee to chest, then switch rapidly. Keeps core under tension while elevating heart rate.
dos: Do keep hips stable and low.
Do keep shoulders over wrists.
donts: Don't bounce hips up and down.
Don't breath.

name: T-Bar Row
description: Rowing a bar that is anchored at one end.
long_description: Straddle the bar. Keep back flat and pull the handle to your chest. Allows for heavy loading of the lats and mid-back.
dos: Do keep your spine neutral.
Do use 25lb plates for better range of motion.
donts: Don't jerky the weight with your legs.
Don't round lower back.

name: Reverse Lunge
description: Stepping backward into a lunge.
long_description: Easier on the knees than forward lunges. Step back, lower hips until back knee hovers the floor, drive forward to return.
dos: Do keep front shin vertical.
Do drive through the front heel.
donts: Don't push off the back foot too much.
Don't slam the knee.

name: Side Lunge
description: Lunging laterally to target hips and adductors.
long_description: Step out to the side, keeping one leg straight while bending the other knee and sitting hips back. Push back to center.
dos: Do keep proper alignment of knee and toe.
Do keep chest up.
donts: Don't let the bent knee cave in.
Don't lift the heel of the bent leg.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
description: Lifting legs while hanging from a bar.
long_description: Hang from a pullup bar. Lift legs until parallel to floor (or toes to bar for advanced). immense core and hip flexor challenge.
dos: Do control the descent.
Do compress the abs.
donts: Don't swing significantly.
Don't hyperextend back at bottom.

name: Plank
description: Isometric core hold.
long_description: Hold a pushup position (on hands or elbows). Keep body in a straight line. Resists gravity and builds endurance.
dos: Do squeeze glutes and quads.
Do push floor away with elbows.
donts: Don't promote hips too high.
Don't sag hips low.

name: Russian Twist
description: Rotational core exercise seated on the floor.
long_description: Sit on floor, lean back slightly, lift feet (boat pose), and rotate torso from side to side holding a weight.
dos: Do follow the weight with your eyes.
Do move with control.
donts: Don't round the back.
Don't just move arms, rotate torso.

name: Single Arm Dumbbell Row
description: Rowing a dumbbell with one hand supported on a bench.
long_description: Kneel on bench with one leg and hand. Pull the dumbbell to the hip with the free hand. Corrects imbalances.
dos: Do flatten your back.
Do pull elbow back toward hip.
donts: Don't rotate torso excessively to throw height.
Don't flare elbow out.

name: Snatch
description: Olympic lift taking the bar from floor to overhead in one motion.
long_description: Highly technical. Requires mobility, speed, and power. Catch the bar in an overhead squat position.
dos: Do get coaching.
Do keep bar close.
donts: Don't muscle it up with arms.
Don't lift heavy without technique.

name: Clean and Jerk
description: Olympic lift taking bar to shoulders (clean) then overhead (jerk).
long_description: The King of lifts. Tests total body strength and coordination.
dos: Do catch the clean with high elbows.
Do drive hard with legs in the jerk.
donts: Don't press out the jerk.
Don't round back on the clean pull.

name: Box Jump
description: Jumping onto a plyo box.
long_description: Stand in front of box. Load hips and swing arms, jumping onto box. Land softly.
dos: Do land softly.
Do stand up fully on the box.
donts: Don't jump down if it hurts knees (step down).
Don't use a box that is too high (shin scrape risk).
